definition: (idiom) with everyone lending a hand (eagerly but somewhat chaotically)
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
foot/leg (of an animal or an object)/base (of an object)/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]/classifier for kicks

sentences.english: They all pitched in and soon finished the job.
sentences.chinese: 大家七手八腳，工作很快就完成了。

sentences.english: With everybody lending a hand, the courtyard was soon swept clean.
sentences.chinese: 大家七手八腳一會兒就把院子打掃乾淨了。

sentences.english: Somehow I managed to lug the wet clothes to the laundromat.
sentences.chinese: 最後我七手八腳的把溼衣服拖到了自助洗衣店裏。

sentences.english: The police bundled him into a car.
sentences.chinese: 警察七手八腳把他推上了汽車。

sentences.english: So it was facing this strain of grass, busy divvying put up a video camera.
sentences.chinese: 於是大家對着這株草，七手八腳地架起了攝像機。

definition: to whisper to one another's ear
to return something to its rightful owner
to nod one's head and bow (idiom); bowing and scraping/unctuous fawning
child bride/girl adopted into a family as future daughter-in-law
lit. spouting smoke through the seven orifices (idiom)/fig. to seethe with anger
see 驚慌失措|惊慌失措[jing1 huang1 shi1 cuo4]
to feel guilty as a thief (idiom); to have sth on one's conscience
